intro: Cracca nitens, commonly known as the white cracca, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes over 12,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its small, white flowers and oval-shaped leaves. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forests and undergrowth. Cracca nitens is often used in horticulture for its ornamental value and ability to thrive in partial shade.
